bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Rodriguez Capote, January 13, 1953

div1.p: Hench writes that he was touched by the tribute that the Cuban government paid to the Yellow Fever Board members by the establishment of the Camp Lazear memorial. He hopes that it will constitute a symbol of Cuban-American cooperation.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Rodriguez Capote, January 13, 1953
div1.opener:
January 13, 1953
Dr. Pedro Rodriguez Capote
Introductor de Embajadores
Ministerio de Estado
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Capote:
div1.p:
I have just received four photographs of the dinner party given last
month by President and Senora Batista for Miss Louise Wood. It was an
honor and pleasure for me to be present on that delightful occasion.
Just after the dinner you kindly gave me three photographs, one of which
President Batista was good enough to autograph for me. But I am very
glad to have also the ones just received as they include some I did not
have.

My sincere pleasure and interest in the affair can be measured, in part,
by noting the intent expression on my face as shown in the photograph
taken when Miss Wood had the honor of receiving her well-deserved
condecoracion from President Batista.

Dr. Capote, I and a great many of my countrymen were deeply touched by
the gracious tribute which the Cuban Government paid to our great
American scientists, Drs. Walter Reed, Jesse Lazear and James Carroll,
who (with your compatriot, Dr. Agramonte) taking their inspiration from
the life's work of your great Carlos Finlay and working mightily in a
common cause, accomplished with Doctor Finlay so much for all mankind.
The establishment and dedication by your government of the “Parque
Monumento Nacional Campamento Lazear” constitutes a beautiful symbol
of Cuban-American cooperation and friendship and of the very real
comradeship which exists between two peace-loving neighbors. This
tribute your American friends will never forget.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
